title: Rand Paul has wildly irresponsible ideas about a future vaccine
description: Rand Paul is a Republican senator from Kentucky. He is also a doctor.

title: Does our blood type make us more vulnerable to Covid-19?
description: Most humans fall into one of four blood groups — A, B, AB or O.

title: CNN anchor: Pence got one thing right in his Covid-19 op-ed
description: As coronavirus surges across most of the US, CNN's Jake Tapper revisits Vice President Mike Pence's Wall Street Journal op-ed where he lauded the Trump administration's response to the pandemic and credited the president's leadership for its success.

title: US has 'several' indications Iran has put portions of air defense on high alert
description: The US has "several" intelligence indications that Iran has put portions of its air defense system on "high alert" in recent days, following unexplained explosions at key facilities tied to the country's military and nuclear programs, according to a US official who is closely tracking developments.

title: Ivanka Trump's alternative universe
description: In a week that has seen the President's daughter hawk beans on her social media account, and unveil a jobs assistance program in the midst of a global pandemic with the awkward moniker of "Find Something New," Ivanka Trump once again finds herself in the middle of a heap of criticism.

title: Burger-flipping robot debuts at restaurant
description: Flippy, a burger-grilling robot, is now manning grill at a California fast food restaurant, using thermal imaging and 3D optics to sense when to flip and remove hamburger patties.

title: Teen reels in 700-pound bluefin tuna after 7-hour fight
description: Three teenage fishermen can tell their friends about the big one that didn't get away after fighting for 7 hours to land a huge bluefin tuna earlier this month off the coast of Maine.

title: A nightmare scenario for farmers is happening right now
description: In early July, farmer Jeremy Storey dropped off an order of eggs at a restaurant's back door as planned and continued on his way.

title: Pentagon reveals some details of Trump's 'super duper' missile
description: Defense officials have revealed to CNN details about the hypersonic missile President Donald Trump has long touted as a "super duper" new military weapon -- part of a major effort to catch up to Russian and Chinese hypersonic weapons programs.

title: CEO's dismemberment sends shock waves through Nigeria's tech community
Florida governor blames media for Florida's Covid-19 response
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar points out the inaccuracies in Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' argument that the media stopped asking about coronavirus in May and is to blame for the public becoming complacent and cases rising.

title: 'Europe's last dictator' causes alarm at US State Department
description: The State Department expressed concern at crackdowns on protesters and journalists after two candidates opposing that country's leader -- nicknamed "Europe's last dictator" -- were disqualified from the race.

title: Jewelry store buries $1M, wants you to find it
description: A Michigan jewelry store has buried approximately one million worth of jewelry throughout the state as it closes due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Revolutionary vaccine enters second round of human trials
description: Imperial College's vaccine trial volunteers are entering the second round of human trials. CNN's Nina dos Santos reports.

title: Even Donald Trump knows he is in deep, deep trouble
description: During his rambling speech in the Rose Garden Tuesday, President Donald Trump pushed back on the idea that his campaign was flailing.

title: The world loves the US dollar. Trump and the pandemic could change that
'Magic School Bus' author Joanna Cole dies age 75
description: Award-winning US author Joanna Cole, who wrote "The Magic School Bus" series and other children's books, has died at the age of 75.

title: Disappearing deep-sea, ultra-black fish mystery solved by scientists
description: The Invisible Man isn't the only expert in making himself imperceptible with optics science. Species of ultra-black fish also have that tactic down pat, according to a study published Thursday in the journal Current Biology.

title: Will Trump try to self-pardon?
description: President Donald Trump has used his pardon power sparingly, but overwhelmingly to benefit his friends and to protect his own interests. Former George W. Bush Administration official Jack Goldsmith recently analyzed Trump's pardons for Lawfare and concluded that "no president in American history comes close to matching Trump's systematically self-serving use of the pardon power."

title: Bacteria that eats metal accidentally discovered by scientists
description: Scientists have discovered a type of bacteria that eats and gets its calories from metal, after suspecting they exist for more than a hundred years but never proving it.

title: Trump puts his China trade deal above all else. It's making his Beijing strategy a mess
Aggressive honey bees at Joshua Tree National Park force multiple campgrounds to close
description: Two areas of Joshua Tree National Park are closed after aggressive honey bees forced the park to clear the areas over the past week.

title: Canada to inessential US travelers: Please stay home
description: The Canadian/US border is expected to remain closed for another 30 days, until August 21.

title: Her husband strangled her. Then her country locked down and now she's forced to live with him
description: Activists in Mexico say lockdown measures put in place to slow the spread of Covid-19 lead to an uptick in domestic violence, especially against women. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

title: Before taking her own life, triathlete asked mother to 'lay bare the sins' of alleged abusers
description: He's a typically proud father as he recalls the joy of his daughter winning a medal.

title: Cats may have been pets along the Silk Road over 1,000 years ago
description: Cats may have been pets for Kazakh pastoralists along the Silk Road over 1,000 years ago, a new study said.

title: Elena Delle Donne 'shocked' her WNBA season medical opt-out request was denied, Mystics say she'll be paid
description: Elena Delle Donne, the reigning WNBA MVP, wants to play basketball.

title: Footage shows ships damaged by fire at Iranian port city
description: A fire has damaged at least seven vessels in a port city in Iran, acording to state media. Just two weeks after a fire at a nuclear complex, it's the latest in a series of mysterious incidents at key locations around the country. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports.

title: Flying photographer shows where we're trashing the planet
description: Flying hundreds of feet above the ground in a motorized paraglider, George Steinmetz has photographed the world's most remote environments from the sky.

title: Vogue's first Black editor-in-chief says he was racially profiled on his way into work
description: British Vogue's editor Edward Enninful said he was racially profiled on the way into work, with a security guard instructing him to enter the magazine's premises via the loading dock.

title: As Trump refuses to lead, America tries to save itself
description:
• Fauci holds ground against 'bizarre' WH attacks
• US continues to set Covid-19 records
• LIVE: 'I just want to do my job,' Fauci says
• Jake Tapper calls out White House

title: As Trump refuses to lead, America tries to save itself
Covid-19 cases among US military causes mistrust in Okinawa
description: More US service members in Okinawa, Japan are testing positive for Covid-19, causing growing mistrust in an already troubled relationship between the two countries.

title: South Korea's president says he's a feminist. Three of his allies have been accused of sex crimes
description: The woman who accused Seoul's mayor of sexual harassment says the city government told her he wasn't "that kind of person" when she made her complaint, according to two non-profit organizations working with her.

title: What it means for Hong Kong as US revokes its special trade status
description: US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order ending Hong Kong's special trade status to treat the city the same as mainland China. He also signed the Hong Kong Autonomy Act into law to sanction businesses and individuals that help China restrict Hong Kong. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports.

title: Drug overdose deaths jump in 2019 to nearly 71,000, a record high
description: Drug overdose deaths in the United States jumped last year by a projected 4.8%, wiping out a slight decline in 2018 and setting a new record high, according to preliminary data released Wednesday by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's National Center for Health Statistics.

title: These states have tamed coronavirus. Here's how they're doing it
description: When Covid-19 suddenly ravaged New York, hospitals looked "apocalyptic." Refrigerated trucks turned into morgues because there wasn't enough space for all the victims.

title: Twitter blames 'coordinated' attack on its systems for massive hack
description: Twitter accounts belonging to Bill Gates, Elon Musk, Apple and Uber, among other prominent handles, were compromised on Wednesday and posted tweets that appeared to promote a cryptocurrency scam.

title: Demi Moore explains her carpeted bathroom
description: Demi Moore's bathroom has gone viral and she thinks it's hilarious.

title: China's economy is growing again. That's good news for the rest of the world
description: China's economy is growing again after its worst three-month period in decades — a sign that could bode well for the global post-coronavirus recovery.

title: Trump shakes up campaign leadership as he struggles in latest polls
description:
• Analysis: 2020's latest boogeyman is 'Secret Trump voters' 
• Poll: Biden takes 15-point lead over Trump
• Analysis: Here's proof that Trumpism is forever

title: Anderson Cooper: Trump poses with can of beans while virus surges
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper called out a recent Instagram endorsement by President Donald Trump amid surges in the coronavirus pandemic across the US and ongoing tension between the White House and Dr. Anthony Fauci, saying it's "grotesque."

title: CNN anchor tweets that he's still waiting for test results. His colleague responds
description: CNN reporters Fred Pleitgen and Victor Blackwell discuss the stark contrast of coronavirus testing in the US and Germany.

title: Trump shakes up campaign leadership as he struggles in latest polls
The Maldives is now open to all global tourists. Here's how they're doing it
description: Though border restrictions and quarantine measures are keeping people from visiting many of the world's most popular travel destinations at the moment, one country famed for its natural beauty is now welcoming all guests -- the Maldives.

title: America's secret weapon against a plummeting world population
description: The only way the United States can remain the world's most prosperous, powerful country is by embracing immigration. That's the inescapable conclusion from a new study published on Tuesday in the Lancet that predicts the world's population will peak far sooner than anticipated, and start shrinking before the end of this century.

title: 33-year-old tech CEO found dismembered in New York apartment
description: A 33-year-old tech CEO was found dismembered in a luxury New York condo, a law enforcement source told CNN.

title: North Carolina city votes to approve reparations for Black residents
description: In a historic move, the city of Asheville, North Carolina, voted unanimously to approve a reparations resolution for Black residents Tuesday night.
